info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 13 at 6:45PM EDT until July 13 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Catawba County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Burke County in western North Carolina... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 644 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles southwest of Hickory, or 5 miles south of Icard, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Longview, Icard, Hildebran, Connelly Springs, Hickory Regional Airport, Mountain View, Rhodhiss, Cooksville, Hickory and Lake Rhodhiss. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Brief damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines over small areas. A brief period of large hail is also possible. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
